title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities 

(International Protection Procedures) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 8th day of 

November 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european community (international protection procedures) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall come operation 8th day november 2022

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: In these Regulations, “Act of 2015” means the International Protection
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Act of 2015” means the International Protection 

Act 2015 (No. 66 of 2015).
text_norm: 2 regulation act 2015 mean international protection act 2015 (no 66 2015)

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: 3. Section 73 of the Act of 2015 is amended in subsection (2) –
text_raw:
3. Section 73 of the Act of 2015 is amended in subsection (2) – 

(a) 

in paragraph (j), by the substitution of “section 16(3);” for 
“section 16(3).”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph (j): 

“(k) whether the applicant is from a safe country of origin; 

(l) 
whether the country of origin of the applicant is a 
country in respect of which there are a large number of 
applications or appeals, and the need to ensure that these and all 
other applications or appeals are dealt with in an efficient 
manner.”.
text_norm: 3 section 73 act 2015 amended subsection (2) - (a) paragraph (j) substitution section 16(3) section 16(3) (b) insertion following paragraph paragraph (j) (k) whether applicant safe country origin (l) whether country origin applicant country respect large number application appeal need ensure application appeal dealt efficient manner

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: 4. The Act of 2015 is amended by the insertion of the following section
text_raw:
4. The Act of 2015 is amended by the insertion of the following section 

after section 73: 

“Acceleration 

73A. (1) Subject to the need for fairness and efficiency in dealing with 
applications for international protection under this Act, the Minister may, 
where he or she considers it necessary or expedient to do so, accelerate the 
examination of any application. 

1 OJ No. L 326, 13.12.2005, p.13 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st November, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 (2) In accelerating, under subsection (1), an examination of any application 
for international protection, the Minister may have regard to the matters in 
paragraphs (a) to (l) of section 73(2).”. 

[541] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 October, 2022. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [541]

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to give further effect in Irish law to the EU 
Directive on minimum standards on procedures in Member States for granting 
and withdrawing refugee status (Council Directive 2005/85/EC). 

The Regulations amend section 73(2) of the International Protection Act 2015 
to add to the list of matters to which the Minister for Justice may have regard 
when deciding whether to prioritise the processing of an application for 
international protection or requesting IPAT to prioritise an appeal. 

The Regulations insert a new section 73A into the International Protection Act 
2015 to enable the Minister to accelerate the examination of any application, 
having regard to the matters in section 73(2). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [541] 5
